website_summaries.verdict: Whether you wear knee socks frequently or simply want a large variety to add to your wardrobe, this affordable set is a good choice.
pros: Value-priced knee socks that come in sets of eight pairs
Socks are made of stretchy, breathable material that provides a snug yet comfortable fit
Choose from a wide variety of solid colors and stylish patterns, as well as two size options
cons: Material is thinner than that of pricier options, so they aren't the best for winter wear
It also tends to bunch up a bit around the toes

customer_reviews.title: The socks are nice and long
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’8” and I wear a 9.5 shoe. The socks are nice and long. Being tall and having big feet (and pretty big calves), knee high socks don’t usually go up that high on me, but surprisingly these did. The only thing about these socks is that they’re not as compressive as I thought they would be, but it does help a little with the swelling (I’ve got major swelling due to pregnancy). My feet and legs definitely don’t feel as fatigued and achy as they normally do when I don’t wear compression socks, and it helps with the pain over my pregnancy induced varicose veins 😩. Overall I like them altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Instantly loved these compression socks as soon as I put them on! They fit pretty well (I typically wear women’s 8), though they do seem to gather a little at the toes, and a bit behind the heal. However, not enough to be annoying. The socks feel good on my feet and legs, they seem to be good quality, and they were an affordable price. Hoping they work out for long uses.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Online Purchase Ever!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for these phenomenal socks that has been a game changer for my normally swollen legs and ankles. I travel a lot for work and Doctors performed test and leg Ultrasounds only to find everything working normally thank God, but, the swelling was awful and embarrassing. No more swelling since I started wearing these socks with my uniform.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like these socks
customer_reviews.text: I like these socks, they are thick and elastic and fit pretty well on my leg. Because of my job, I need to stand and walk around for a long period of time, and these socks helped relief my pain. I personally high recommend them to anyone who suffer from deep vein thrombosis and those who need to be on their feet all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Xiao Chen

customer_reviews.title: End of Pregnancy Lifesaver for Swollen Feet
customer_reviews.text: I was getting super swollen feet and ankles towards the end of my third trimester of pregnancy. I finally broke down and desperately ordered these compression socks at 4am one night, and am so thankful I did. Within two days of wearing compression socks, my swelling was almost completely gone and my feet were feeling so much better. The photo is a before and after shot...a huge difference from wearing the socks for only a couple days!I know that every woman is different and every pregnancy is different, though if you're struggling with swollen feet towards the end I can't recommend these socks highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit
customer_reviews.text: Not for most women. Way too big all around. Foot too big. I wear a size 9 shoe and the toes bunch up. Length is about 2 inches above my knees. Little to no compression
customer_reviews.author: Diane M.

customer_reviews.title: Feet odor
customer_reviews.text: At first they seemed to work as expected, and as far as compression socks go, they do. However, I assume that because of the material, which doesn't seem breathable, they may give you foot odor, which is a problem I have never had before. The socks themselves, once washed, do not retain odor, but as you wear them throughout the day and sweat, they will make your feet reek. I am now considering how to get rid of this problem that I have never had before. I'll possible have to get rid of shoes that have retained the odor. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made socks. The material isn’t sufficient to be considered compression socks. They’re like cheap nylon socks. And the shipping took WAY too long.... Definitely would NOT recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jennika R. Spanarkel

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.text: Out of 7 pairs, I wore the first pair yesterday and a second pair today. By the end of the day, there was a hole on the sole of the sock. I didn’t do anything strenuous today. I wore them to school and sat most of the day. Very disappointed in the quality. I don’t feel the quality accurately depicts what it’s intended to do. Save your money and buy a 6 pack of Hanes socks instead.
customer_reviews.author: lexidarlin

customer_reviews.title: Wow, great fit on my large calves.
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews on so many socks I couldn't keep track any longer. I have big calves, 18 inches at widest and I am short. I have always had this size so I know the problems with finding socks. I am returning to work as a nurse after 15 years off and I'm trying to prevent problems. I read that many people with 17 inch calves could wear these without problem so I took a chance. They are amazing. easy to get on, come right to my knees, soft. Not tight on toe area. Gives my legs an almost tingle. And 7 pair for this price, can't beat it. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: She tried them on and could not wait to call me and let me know how comfortable they are
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my mother who has circulation problems. She tried them on and could not wait to call me and let me know how comfortable they are. She has to wear them every day and was amazed at how comfortable. They were easy to put on, which made her very happy. The price was great as these are usually so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: jmbilletTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Broken socks
customer_reviews.text: Some socks were broken after 3-4 times used. Definitely not a good quality. I have already returned these products but did not receive full refunds.
customer_reviews.author: P.H.

customer_reviews.title: At last, compression socks that are easy to get on!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing compression socks for the last 5 years based on a recommendation from my vascular surgeon, who wears them as well. I had a DVT (blood clot in my leg vein). At one point this gave me a pulmonary embolism. Fortunately I have survived without issue, but it is important to me to wear compression socks. In the past, the socks have been very difficult to get on. It took about 5 minutes to get my old socks on. These seem to give the same compression, but are much easier to get on. I don't know if it is the fabric or what, but these almost slip on.
customer_reviews.author: locomac

customer_reviews.title: Makes your feet sweat like you are walking in a puddle.
customer_reviews.text: socks compress my toes too much and they make my feet sweat. By the end of the day it feels like I am walking in puddles and I leave footprints of moisture when I take my shoes off. I sent a note via Amazon to the seller and was told he needed to respond within 2 days. That was 7 days ago and he NEVER responded. I would have returned them, but returning used socks is gross, so I didn't. But now I'm stuck with 7 pairs of useless socks. I DO NOT recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Good for compression, but thick
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a small/medium, which fit as expected Pros: - Provides good compression, which has helped with achy feet and legs. - Has withstood several washes without compromising the integrity of the compression. Cons: - When stretched, the material shows a blend of white and nude rather than just nude coloring. - Material was thicker than I expected. - Not as breathable as I would have liked, causing my feet to sweat more.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: Papikin pulled a switch. Don't buy these socks!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the Bluetree socks, and ordered six mote. Instead I got "Wonder Socks." No compression number, and there was a strong chemical odor when I opened the packages. I washed and rinsed them thoroughly, but not all of the smell is gone. I wrote Papikin to ask what the compression is, and all he wrote back is they are for nurses, etc., not for people who need compression socks for edema.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: And the bottom line is the price was excellent, for the cost of one pair I received ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the s-m however I would prefer them to be a bit smaller. I thought the sock was listed as a women’s size however possibly it is intended for unisex wear. I use between a size 7 - 8 shoe dependent on the manufacturer. The quality seems adequate for compression hose. The material is not as substantial as “big-name” manufacturers. The compression seems adequate for mild condition use. And the bottom line is the price was excellent, for the cost of one pair I received a bag of seven pair.
customer_reviews.author: A Khan

customer_reviews.title: These are not compression stockings
customer_reviews.text: I'm having trouble with my feet and ankles swelling, my doc told me to get some compression stockings and I was elated to find these. So cute, lots of different colors and a great price considering the amount of socks you get. Laite Hebe compression socks are sadly not compression socks. There is too much material around the toe causing them to bunch up making them uncomfortable at the least, but worse there is no compression at all. More like fashion knee high socks. I'm returning.
customer_reviews.author: munchkin

customer_reviews.title: Wearing for 2 years, very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I take medication that causes my feet and lower legs to swell. I've been wearing these socks for 2 years, and they're very comfortable, and the eliminate virtually all the swelling. I always wash my socks cold, always hang to dry, but over time they lost elasticity and did not compress as well. I'm replacing them at 2 years, but now that I have new socks and can feel the difference, I realize I should have replaced them a year ago. (This is normal. Even high-dollar compression socks need replaced. I just didn't realize how much they'd changed.) I'll definitely be buying more of these socks in another year.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Cravens

customer_reviews.title: No compression ...
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in these socks. I wear a woman's size 6.5-7 shoe and ordered the S/M, which is supposed to fit between a size 5.5-8.5, so I thought they should be good. They fit ok in the foot, but there is very little, if any, "compression" whatsoever, (and I have fairly large calves - can't wear a lot of boots). They fit like a regular sock -- not a compression sock. I do have some other compression socks, which were much pricier and they do compress properly, so I know how these should feel.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lawton

customer_reviews.title: Easy Fit
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these compression socks because as a nurse I'm on my feet 12 hours or more since Covid 19. At the end of my day, my legs and feet do not have half of the aches and pains I had before. Love the different designs. My daughter is a nurse too, thinking about ordering her some too. They were not hard to get on/off like some other compression socks. I wear a size 8 shoe, but order large so they can come up to my knees.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. B

customer_reviews.title: Well made great value
customer_reviews.text: What I love: The same size fits my large calves and my husband’s thin calves. These socks are durable. They survived my dogs playing tug of war as well as a year of wear and washing. They go on easily and still give noticeable compression. After wearing them all day both my husband and I noticed our legs felt better and less tired and heavy. What I don’t love: they are hot. You definitely sweat more while wearing. They can leave a mark just below the knee. These aren’t loose at the top like over the knee compression socks. That tightness can be painful after 12 hours of wear. This is not enough for us to stop using them.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy stylist

customer_reviews.title: This has  the best item I have ever gotten online.
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from diabetes and varicose veins and usually can’t walk more than a block without resting. I wore the socks the first day I received Them. I never expected the comfort I felt and wore them all day. They have great compression and don”t slip or bunch up. I love the fact that they are knee high which give great support without feeling tight. I did receive 7 pairs even though the ad said 6 pairs. That really surprised me me as I have one pair for each day of the week, I let the people I have contact with and they are going to place orders. Thanks for making such a great productt.
customer_reviews.author: stan

customer_reviews.title: Don't pass these by, they are wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I love these socks. They are the perfect amount of compression. I bought them in anticipation of a hip replacement. I can't take blood thinners and know that frequently moving, performing certain exercises and compression socks are all good preventatives. They are not as compressive as TEDS but I wasn't looking for something that extreme either. They are serving the purpose for which intended post-op and I will definitely wear them after recovery. I am size 7.5 shoe and the small/medium fit well. They feel great on my legs and stay up easily without cutting off circulation near the knee. Love them and highly recommend. Would definitely use these for air travel too.
customer_reviews.author: 2pets1bird

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks!
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from neuropathy in my feet and swelling (fluid) in my legs. These compression socks have helped out a lot. I was able to put a pair of boots on that I bought some time ago but couldn't get into, because my ankles swelled so bad. They still swell a bit but nothing like they use to, when I wear these socks. The color variety pack is perfect for my selection of pants. I am so impressed that I am going to order another set, from this vendor, through Amazon. I thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Paul L. Doherty

customer_reviews.title: normally I have reservations about compression socks.  Not this time.
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman who wears a 9.5 shoe and was glad I purchased the large and not the smaller one. In the past I have always found two obstacles to compression socks: they are far too expensive and far too tight. After purchasing the first bag I returned and bought another bag. My first reaction upon putting it on is: "This has some compression but is comfortable and does not feel like it is choking me. I bet I could wear them every day they are so comfortable." But I still feel there is something of a compression value being accomplished. I am grateful to the vendor. I do truly love them.
customer_reviews.author: Readaholic

customer_reviews.title: Needed for shin splints
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these after ordering a single pair from another company for around the same price. I need them for running. I get terrible shin splints and the other pair I purchased made them disappear completely. The ones I purchased here help a lot but I still have a little pain especially on longer runs. These are not as tight as the more expensive ones but they still compress. I think these are perfect for shorter runs but I'll be buying the more expensive ones for longer runs. The amount you get for your money here is fantastic though. I do recommend these for shorter runs.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! After reading product reviews I thought to give them a try and I was not dissapointed! I am a chef in my 50's and have been in kitchens for 40 years. Needless to say my feet and legs have taken a beating! I was worried they would be too tight to out on but they were not. After the first wash and dry they are a little tighter but I can still get them on without much trouble. As far as helping my legs? Spot on! I haven't had leg pain since I got these. They fit and feel great. Since I got so many I dont need to buy anymore but will definitely recommend them!!
customer_reviews.author: Nana of 9

customer_reviews.title: Give Good Support But Slide Down
customer_reviews.text: My mom has varicose so I ordered these for her. They provide a good amount of support for the calf and overall the leg. They are well made, sturdy and durable. The compression socks come in a pack of 7 pairs. I liked that they come in 7 different neutral colors and go with all outfits. She wears a women's size 6.5 US shoes and the small size fit me perfectly. However, I found that the sock tend to slide down and the top elastic is too tight. It elastic band leaves marks on the leg and it also starts hurting if worn for a long period of time.
customer_reviews.author: REYA

customer_reviews.title: Supportive and comfy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the full compression socks after first trying the compression calf sleeve by this same company. I liked the calf sleeve a lot. Sizing is by calf measurement for both products, so the fit of the foot part of the full sock was in question. For me, the calf sleeve fits better but I have to wear a pair of regular socks with it. But the full sock is good. It's very comfy and offers enough support, and look like regular socks. I've even worn them with a low heel. ETA: A second purchase ... got the smaller size and the foot portion fits much better. The calf portion is still supportive and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product!
customer_reviews.text: I recommend these to everyone that have problems with legs and feet. I received these today. Put them on as soon as I received. Fantastic all the problems I have with feet and legs surprisingly helped almost instantly! For the money and amount you receive it’s a no brainer! Strongly recommend. You won’t be unhappy. As I said it’s my first day, so I will update after I give them at least a week. Five star for first day for sure. Ive spent so much money for doctors sending me for compression socks. Thought why not try these?!? They are better much better then prescription ones! Plus saving money definitely helps! I’d be surprised if anyone reading this is unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe Girl

customer_reviews.title: Make my feet sweat
customer_reviews.text: These compression socks fit as expected. I have a 32 inch inseam and these socks are long enough. The colors are not true to the photo. I ordered the multi colored and, e.g., the black ones have fluorescent green stripes up the back instead of a softer green as shown in the photo. The orange ones are fluorescent orange as well. Also, I do not like this fabric. They caused my feet to sweat. Also, they did not do as well at compression as other socks I have tried, such as Sockwell. Overall, they get two stars for fitting well and arriving quickly but I can't recommend them beyond that.
customer_reviews.author: brains on fire

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money
customer_reviews.text: If I could rate this 0 stars, I would. All the socks I got didn't fit me (women's size 9) or my friend (women's size 7) when they were supposed to be XL. Aside from the fact they strangle the heck out of my legs, they're also terrible quality on the inside making it very difficult to put them on without ripping. You can see in the picture the fabric is very messed up, and all the pairs I got were like that. I'm a huge fan of long socks. It's sad I got a pair for 1.25 from the dollar store that's better quality and actually stretch to fit comfortably...
customer_reviews.author: Alex Marie

customer_reviews.title: No more swollen ankles
customer_reviews.text: They fit wonderfully everywhere but the toe. They are a little large in the toe. This is my first time purchasing any compression socks so I don't have anything to compare them to but I can tell you that I have been amazed by how much better my feet, ankles, and legs feel at the end of the work day. My left ankle is usually swollen double by the end of the day and it has not been since I started wearing these. I am a teacher and on my feet the majority of the day and I can really tell a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Socks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased compression socks for while and always found them to be difficult to put on and after a while would cut off my circulation. These socks are very comfortable and easy to put on. I really like wearing them and at then of the day my circulation is not cut off. I have been wearing the socks for a week now and have thrown my other socks away. These socks feel good and do the job. I am planning on purchasing another set next month.
customer_reviews.author: Detlev

customer_reviews.title: Not as tight, but maybe that's okay
customer_reviews.text: These are not quite as tight as what I'm used to with compression socks, so at first I was skeptical. I really want to be a sausage when it comes to my compression. But, over time, I have come to prefer them over the tighter ones. They still make my legs (varicose veins are my biggest problem) not feel fatigued at the end of the day, and I haven't noticed my veins getting any worse. I've had them for over six months and they've held up GREAT in the wash. I think they are worth not being as tight, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: fortheloveofvelvet

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit men's size foot. Does not come up above the calf because the cut of the sock too small. Sized incorrectly.
customer_reviews.text: These would be great if they were actually sized correctly. The quality is good and fabric good. They are NOT sized for a man and thus absolutely do not fit.Size is small and the sock does not come up above the calf enough to stay up. I can not recommend this product because it is too small despite being ok in quality. This product should be labeled for women only not for any man. I have US size 10 men foot.
customer_reviews.author: Technocat

customer_reviews.title: Best Socks for Desk Job
customer_reviews.text: Finally, no more swollen calves! I was forced to take a job where I must sit all day which has been detrimental to my health. I am 60 years old and have always been very active until now. I now see why so many people are overweight and generally unhealthy-from being forced to sit all day in a cubicle. Anyway, after just a few months , my calves and ankles began to swell. Being an avid jogger did nothing to detour this ailment. My sister told me to try compression socks, and just a week later my calves were no longer swollen and have not been for months now.
customer_reviews.author: Pikki Vikki

customer_reviews.title: Fit and fashionable compression socks
customer_reviews.text: One of the most amazing things that can happen to your feet is Compression Socks. I absolutely love the variety in this order, as it makes wearing compression socks fashionable while tending to your body needs. The designs on the socks I love. Great for athletes like myself who at over 40 years of age experience swelling, achy legs and feet. After use, I was able to see a difference in circulation. Ordering was easy, shipment was received in a timely manner. The quality of the socks are great. I ordered a small/medium and I wear a size 8 shoe- The fit was perfect. They come up to my knees.
customer_reviews.author: Niedria

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and help tired and aching feet and legs
customer_reviews.text: I was right on the borderline of which size to order. The mediums are for sizes up to women’s 9 and the large are for sizes starting at women’s 10. I wear a 9 1/2 shoe so sized up so they wouldn’t be too tight. These are plenty long in the foot for me so I think I should have gotten the medium. They are very comfortable socks and have really helped the discomfort in my legs. I sleep so much better at night if 8 have worn these socks throughput the day. I would recommend these for anyone who stands a lot or if you suffer from tired or aching legs and feet.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: weird fit
customer_reviews.text: I was going to replace most of my socks with these but the fit is weird. I'm a size 10 and I ordered the large because of the way the sizing was presented. These are long enough to go over my knee which is not what I was looking for, in a knee sock, and the toe box is too large too. The extra fabric wants to bunch in my shoes and they twist on my foot, the heel trying to come around to the front. I'm going to try drying them a couple of times and then donate them if they remain unworkable. They might be good for a taller person with bigger feet.
customer_reviews.author: Brookdancer

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected issue. I do NOT recommend
customer_reviews.text: Tried my first pair today. Was surprised when a little way into my day my legs started HURTING. I wear compression socks daily because they normally make my legs feel great. The moment I got home I immediately removes them to find the inside stitching (from the outward pattern) does not lay flat. Bumched up, non finished pattern stitching, combined with compression, equals skin branding discomfort. Poor quality. Ver disappointed. I have photos but I do not see a place to add them.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 5

customer_reviews.title: Good solid quality for a good solid price.
customer_reviews.text: Good product with solid quality. I found myself at a 15hrs/day behind the desk kind of a job, and these have been a lifesaver. This was my first time trying nude compression socks and they felt a little too "grandma-yellowish" for me and in the wider parts of my leg it looked like I could see the white a little. Having said that, the black ones are just perfect, and there is no white anywhere even in the wider parts where it stretches. I was pleasantly surprised that these socks made as much of a positive difference as the more expensive $30/pair socks that I purchased last time at Walgreens.
customer_reviews.author: BHS

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: These compression socks were exactly what I expected and, for the price, are a reasonable buy. I have purchased other compression socks that were excellent quality but one pair cost 7 dollars more for one pair than this whole package of eight pairs did. These are a good middle ground if you are looking for a balance between price and quality. I would definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hinckley

customer_reviews.title: Great Compression Socks
customer_reviews.text: Update on my review: only after 2 times using these socks, I already have a run in the fabric. Not sure if these are very durable Exactly what you look for in compression socks. I am a nurse, so I am always on my feet - that also means I’ve tried a fair deal of compression socks. I like these socks because they provide a good amount of compression without being impossible to put on, plus they are tall enough they won’t fall down your calves. I gave them 4 stars because I received two of the same pair of socks and there is no way to contact the seller on amazon, which is very inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad, but read reviews before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: Not too bad for the price. They’re not quite as tight as my medically prescribed stockings that are also 15-20mm Hg compression, but they did the trick. I wore them all day and didn’t have the aching in my legs and feet. However, they are ribbed all the way through, including on the soles - so this caused some friction and burning sensation on the soles of my feet. Also, they’re a little big in the toes; I had a lot of leftover fabric around my toes. I wear size 7.5-8 shoe and got size S/M stockings.
customer_reviews.author: RuthieB

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price, but very small for wide calves
customer_reviews.text: They are ok for the price. I have 15” wide calves and bought S/M and they fit ok until I washed them. They shrunk quite a bit and are very tight now. I’m using them anyways but I can’t wait to take them off by the end of my shift. Also the designs left deep marks on my legs which was very uncomfortable. Maybe if I had gotten a size larger it would have been better but I went with their measurements and it didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: MGerhard

customer_reviews.title: Great value for compression socks.
customer_reviews.text: Great price for compression socks... a nurse where I worked turned me on to them. I used to wear Jobst which were $17.00 a pair. These are almost as good. Jobst quit making the ones I liked. I have tried several brands. Most are too thin, like panty hose. Others I have tried are so thick I cant wear them with some of my shoes. These are thicker without changing my shoe size 6 1/2. I would give them 5 stars if they came in a smaller size. Will recommend to patients, and buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Rose

customer_reviews.title: Toe room is a winner for me.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sock. Delivery was right on time. Altho one reviewer wasn't happy that there was a bit of extra room in the toes, that feature is what makes these socks my favorite support socks. After wearing other (& more expensive socks) all day, my toes felt as if they were welded together. These sock give me wriggle room and allow my toes to move during the day without riding up & becoming too tight. I wear a women's size 10 and ordered the L/EXL size which fit me perfectly. I am ordering more and giving my other support socks to a humane soc. thrift shop.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Meh!
customer_reviews.text: I’m still undecided if I like these socks. I’m a size 9-1/2 woman’s shoe. I’m also rather tall and have long legs. That said, I would say that the recommended size sock for my shoe size is a bit too large. The socks are also very long and could go over my knee with a bit more tugging. I don’t like that the toe part has a seam. Those seams always seem to rub against my shoe and bother my toes. So, in conclusion, I’ll keep the socks And hope they shrink with washing and that the seams on the toes soften up.
customer_reviews.author: NY chic

customer_reviews.title: These socks are great - having issues with legs the Dr suggested support ...
customer_reviews.text: These socks are great - having issues with legs the Dr suggested support socks. My job in the PD has me sitting 8 hours a day at computers and working 2nd job in theater in Buffalo where floors are marble for anyplace from 5 to 8 hours a night. My legs have never felt better. Gone are the leg cramps, legs losing the color they were turning. Support of socks are fantastic. Quality is 5 stars, and unlike other “support” socks that tend to slowly roll down - these stay in place as you expect them to - will be ordering another bag soon. - 03/24/18 my 2nd package arrived and got to say these socks are EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.author: you will get the facts

customer_reviews.title: Compression Socks that don't advertise themselves.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a women's size 6.5 to 7 and usually still shop in the children's section, yet I found my toes felt squished in these socks. Also, I had to really, really work to get it all the way up my calf in the back. It seemed inclined to stop 2-3 inches short. Now that could just be due to the width of my calf, but it was a little disappointing. I feel a good amount of support and do not find them too uncomfortable (other than my poor toes). They were definitely worth the money. I love that you can wear the socks with business pants and not have anyone know!
customer_reviews.author: Christine B

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Design for Compression Socks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these patterned compression socks for my husband to wear in Europe as we would be walking and standing extensively, and he wanted colorful fun socks for his wardrobe. The first day he wore a pair we discovered after he removed them that they had left awful impressions on his lower legs from the patterns. This is when we found that the patterns are made from separately sewn in pieces of fabric, so when turned inside out there are large lumps of seamed fabric throughout. Obviously since compressions socks are tight, these leave very large impressions in the skin which isn't good for circulation. They are now useless as he will no longer wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara McIver

customer_reviews.title: Good compression, great for pregnancy, runs hot
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the last few months of my pregnancy. I could not go a day without these socks or my feet and legs were swollen and sore. They have great compression, but they are HOT (but also keep in mind I was pregnant when wearing these). They have really strong elastic, which I imagine for a non 8-month pregnant lady would be fairly easy to get on. My only "complaint" is that the black socks were about a half inch longer than the tan, so I had to fold over the very tops otherwise they came to the middle of my knees which was uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kalin K.

customer_reviews.title: Super cheap material and feels like it.
customer_reviews.text: Feels like your wearing gritty plastic on the bottom of your feet Super thin. I have a pair of medical grade socks that are incredibly superior to this. These are made to the lowest standard possible. There is anti-warmth from these socks !!!!. Again, what would you expect for so many pairs of socks for soooo little money. I am learning not to buy certain items because of the cheap cost. Manufacturers do not give away their product at cheap prices unless they are cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: ez

customer_reviews.title: Helps with swollen feet and ankles.
customer_reviews.text: First, I had compression sock when I was pregnant and they helped a whole lot. So, I need some more for the long hours of standing on my feet and all the pounding they took. I wanted something colorful. Which these are colorful and comfortable to my feet. At the end of day my feet and ankles were the same size as I woke up. I have varicose veins on my feet, which they do hurt sometimes. I will raise my legs or wear the socks at night and raise them up. They stop hurting in a matter of minutes. I thought the price was right for how many pairs you can get.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Janot

customer_reviews.title: They're just OK
customer_reviews.text: They fit well and are made pretty nicely, but the packaging says you can't machine wash them. It says "Dry Dean" which I'm assuming is supposed to be "Dry Clean". Odd. I'm still going to machine wash! Also, there's not as much compression as I thought there would be. They're harder to get on because there is some compression, but once they're on they don't feel as snug
customer_reviews.author: Liz Fisk

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated
customer_reviews.text: They fit fine and made me feel more comfortable on a long flight. My dissatisfaction with them came after wearing - I washed a pair with a load of other clothes - they were the only items in the load that hadn't been washed before, and the color bled on some other items. I think that I was able to get the color out of my other items when I rewashed, but that should not happen without warning that it could! So either wash separately or use a color catcher.
customer_reviews.author: HSMomof3

customer_reviews.title: Best Socks Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I was paying 19.99 out of a brochure magazine for just one pair of the compression socks. As soon as I got these, I immediately put a pair on and the difference in the support and level of compression was noticed with in a few minutes. 7 pair for 23.99 and a much more superior product than I was buying blew me away. I want to buy again, but I got 7 pairs! 7 pairs more is a bit much, but this is such a great bargain for an excellent product, I just can not pass it up. I highly recommend these compression socks to anyone that needs to wear them, you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: George Tryon III

customer_reviews.title: Great light-compression socks, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am pleasantly surprised at how nice these light-compression socks are. The toes have room so your toenails don't get pressure on them. They have a nice, even light compression through the foot and leg, and the best part for me is that they don't pinch and leave marks up at the knee. I machine wash them and line dry them. They are not super warm socks. I don't know if I'd wear them in the summer, but they are perfect for fall and probably winter too. You just can't beat the price too.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these at the request of my wife - She uses them every working day and appreciates the extra support that they provide. However she's a rather tiny woman at 5' around 100 lbs soaking wet and even the Small size are not quite at supportive as she'd like. No fault of the product it's just that she's a very small woman and we haven't been able to find any Extra Small support stockings - Hence the 4 star rating. Great product and Great Value though! Thanks
customer_reviews.author: deuce32

customer_reviews.title: Must buy if you need Support Hose!!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, I had misgivings about quality due to the low price. I’m glad I jumped into the water so to speak! These are great! I bought the assorted colors (to wear with different outfits). You cannot tell they are support socks. They do a great job for prolonged sitting or standing. I’m young (40) and just started to need support hose after 5 children and a full time job where I have to sit for 6-8 hours straight. I was getting horrible bloating and swelling in my legs. These do the job. They are light-medium support and are comfy to the point you can sleep with them. Definitely recommend and I’m ordering another set!
customer_reviews.author: The_Koo

customer_reviews.title: Compression socks
customer_reviews.text: this was my 2nd order of them. The first ones had an L woven inside the cuff so if you put it on the left side of leg the heels pulled up square. This order does not have any indicator so harder to get heel centered when putting on. These are also shorter, they do not go as far up on calf as previous socks ending on my thickest part of calf which the cuff is too tight for. This was a re-order so I expected the same product. Obviously a reseller and they found a cheaper for them product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top cuff too tight, not wearable
customer_reviews.text: So far 2 pair have the top cuff not as stretchy as the body of the sock which leads to constriction just below the knee. A bad thing. I do NOT have a large calf. I have had another member of my family try them and they too thought they were way too tight at the top. The foot part is a bit too large but wearable but with the top cuff being too tight these are not wearable as the defeat the whole purpose of the socks to aid in circulation.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado gal

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up from me!
customer_reviews.text: I’m totally a noob when it comes to compression socks. I thought they would squeeze my calf, and I didn’t like the thought of that. How wrong was I?! Very, as it happens. I can’t detect any squeezing, although I know the compression is nearer the ankles, which I can feel when I’m putting them on. I ordered the L/XL since I wear size 11 women shoes. They have room and don’t cramp my toes. My primary care doctor recommended that I try these, and I’m glad I did. They can be machine washed and dried, which is such a win for this busy lady. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jane Holland

customer_reviews.title: This years best purchase for me on Amazon (out of 90 orders this year)
customer_reviews.text: Having worn compression socks that you must wrestle to put on, actually feel too tight and can't wear all day, I found these. Not only have I found them, I gave a pair to my neighbor and step father. They both loved them also and have ordered a package. They can be worn comfortably all day and are easy to put on. My legs feel 20 years younger!
customer_reviews.author: Justavet

customer_reviews.title: All day wear
customer_reviews.text: Great so far as I bought them for two reason. I just hate dress socks the fall, lose their elasticity and just thin. My feet hurt coming home. These help, not much yes but enough for me to notice. That and I'm not pulling them up or fidgeting with them. Stay up all day, all night . make the circulation in your legs feel so much better and a little less pain. I wear them with my pj shorts at night cause ok pants bunch up. And there these are like tights keeping my legs warm. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sinner

customer_reviews.title: SIZE IS NOT COMPARABLE OR ACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: This size for women is NOT the same for men. Bought for a man and this is more like a size for a smaller woman. Whoever decided this was okay for labeling needs a lesson in female to male size comparison. Not a happy customer. Had these delivered as a gift and just arrived to their home only to be handed this item and told it was too small. Looked at them and maybe they should be on a petite older child or Smaller teen?
customer_reviews.author: Maura Newcastle

customer_reviews.title: Very good compression socks
customer_reviews.text: These are very good compression socks at a reasonable price. I purchased several packages for both quantity and to have a variety of colors. I have been very pleased with socks from all of the packages. The socks fit comfortably and work well They are well packaged which protected them in shipping and in storage until I'm ready to open a new pair. Have held up well in several washings. I am pleased with them and will purchase them again when I need more.
customer_reviews.author: Rock

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: The socks are quite comfortable to wear. There is a learning curve to putting them on though. They seem to run a bit big, especially before being washed. I bought the smallest size, ( I wear a size 7 1/2 women's shoe) and they are just a tad too large. They did fit better though after washing. They come up to just under the knee, and don't roll down, and don't cut off the circulation at the top. All in all, I think they are very nice for the price, which was quite reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkles60

customer_reviews.title: the feet are way too large
customer_reviews.text: They need to create compression socks in size "small". I'm a small woman, and wear size 6 shoes, but that is no reason the size S/M socks should be this large in the foot. The extra fabric would bunch up and create abrasion on my toes. As a couple other reviewers suggested, I even tried cutting off the toes, but that only made them creep up and bunch up in my instep. Fortunately, the seller was very good about accepting the return.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Great product at great price
customer_reviews.text: I love these! Great price at $19.99 for 6 pair. I have been wearing these everyday since I got them. They are great for work and working out. I had seen some online for almost $50/pair and thought that was crazy. I found these on Amazon and thought I would give them a try. So far, so good. Fit just as expected and really help with my legs as I stand a lot at work. They are also great for running and wearing at the gym. Hopefully they hold up but I won't know that for awhile!
customer_reviews.author: respibob

customer_reviews.title: Helps With Swelling
customer_reviews.text: I walk around a lot at work, and of course, the base of the floor is concrete. My feet and legs give me a fit at night, so a nurse told me about these socks. My only issue is by the end of the day because they are a little long for my short legs, just below my knee I feel the tightness of the socks and can't wait to get home and peel them off. Other than that they are working out great.
customer_reviews.author: H. B. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what they describe
customer_reviews.text: Not going to lie, I was nervous ordering these from amazon. I am very glad I did though. I have very bold muscular calfs with striations and want to slim them down. I wear between a 9 and a 10 women's shoe size and these were just a tad bit too large in the foot. I work on my feet 90% of my work shift but never got that bunched sock feeling in my shoes. I probably would in heals though. Overall I'm very pleased with these and will continue to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: A SUPPORT STOCKING WITH STYLE, EASE TO PUT ON AND DO THE JOB
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY someone came out with support stockings or TED hose that not only look nice but are a breeze to put on. I went with your size suggestion and they fit perfectly. The best part for me was that they just pulled on. No turning inside out and tugging for 5 minutes. They just pulled on, but they are snug enough to do the job. Finally but not least is the look. No more the "medical old lady" look. These are cute and sporty. With the different colors I can mix and match with my outfits. I can't wait to get more.
customer_reviews.author: CORGI MOM

customer_reviews.title: Good socks. No compression
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of compression socks. I didn't know where to start so I bought 5 different brands. These socks are really comfortable but they do not relieve any pain from my legs. All of my normal knee high socks feel exactly the same as these. I don't believe I have small legs either. I would not buy these again since they have zero compression quality. You might as well buy cheap long black socks.
customer_reviews.author: Lukextwo

customer_reviews.title: Heads Up: if you need compression socks due to a medical condition, consider going with the plain.
customer_reviews.text: While these are more comfortable than any other compression socks I've tried, stay up like they're supposed to without binding and do an excellent job with my leg swelling, some of the patterns are stitched on rather than screen printed or woven in. This leaves wads of thread on the inside(see photo) which in turn create dozens of pressure points and indentations in the skin when my legs swell - not something you want with certain conditions. Needless to say, I can really only wear approximately half of the number that came with my order which is a shame since I love the patterns.
customer_reviews.author: L.

customer_reviews.title: Superior to others I've bought
customer_reviews.text: This is the 5th set of compression socks that I've bought and used, and by FAR my favorite! Well made, surprisingly easy to put on! The other brands are thinner, and much more difficult to put on. This set also comes up completely to my knee where all of the others stop short. The others leave a deep impression from the top band whereas this set does not. It is also MUCH more durable with little tendency to snag. Others have torn, and all of the others both snagged and suffer from rubber fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lubbock

customer_reviews.title: On your feet all day you need these ASAP!  They are amazing
customer_reviews.text: Heavy compression, which I love. If you are on your feet all day you need these, or a frequent flyer. They are wonderful. They reduce leg fatigue that you get from running the desk to task & repeat. Up down up down & repeat. Great price, fast shipping, colors are built for business suits. After 18 hours on your feet you'll love these socks! I've bought the more than once.
customer_reviews.author: K. Saiz

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These fit perfect and are very comfortable. This is my second package of 7 socks, bought the colored ones this time. Great value. Again as before I recommend using calf size instead of shoe size. I bought shoe size with the first pack and they were way to big. The calf size were perfect. I was able to sell the first pack to a friend and purchase the right size that fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: N. Rupp

customer_reviews.title: Makes my legs less tired.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these compression socks because I spend a lot of time walking as most nurses do. My legs ache at the end of the day so I thought I'd give compression socks a try. I researched and read lots of reviews on this particular brand and style. I've been wearing them for a week and my legs feel great at the end of a long day of walking and there's a a bit of extra space around the toes. I would definitely recommend them to anyone who is on their feet all day.
customer_reviews.author: Mobius56

customer_reviews.title: They have helped to reduce the swelling in my lower legs after just one day of wearing them!
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing so many similar products, my wife decided to go with this one. After reading so many reviews of so many compression socks, she was primarily interested in the fit. She is 5'5" and weighs 120 pounds, and the S/M fit was perfect. And the morning after the first day of wearing them, swelling from fluids in her feet, ankles and calves had diminished considerably. She suffers from congestive heart failure following a heart attack, and the fluid meds were helping, but these socks really supplemented the meds. She has been wearing them from when she first gets up in the morning until she goes to bed at night. And so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Keith M

customer_reviews.title: NOT actual compression socks
customer_reviews.text: As a runner, I’ve worn compression socks for years for recovery. I should have listened to the few reviewers who mentioned this. These are cheap tight socks with zero actual compression. Got what I paid for, which should have been a red flag. Real compression socks are expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Police  Motors

customer_reviews.title: NICE PRODUCT, FITS GOOD.  GREAT VALUE.
customer_reviews.text: I WAS PLEASANTLY SURPRISED WITH MY PURCHASE. I THOUGHT IT WAS A GREAT VALUE FOR 8 PAIRS, THEY FIT GOOD, POSSIBLY THE L/XL WOULD NOT BE A GOOD FIT FOR SHOE SIZE SMALLER THAN WOMEN'S 7. I DID NOT WANT A TIGHT FIT AS MY CALVES ARE NOT ON THE THIN SIDE SO I ORDERED L/XL. I HAVE WASHED AND DRIED THEM SEVERAL TIMES AND STILL HELD UP AND LOOKED AS NEW AS WHEN I OPENED THE PACKAGE. HOPEFULLY, THIS WILL CONTINUE AND I WILL BE SATISFIED IN SIX MONTH.
customer_reviews.author: marilyn

customer_reviews.title: You get a fair qaulity item for a fair price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these items to aid with my poor and I am a newish diabetic. My feet are starting to complain and diabetic socks cost way to much. The sock is fair qaulity but the seams are weak and must be burnt or they will continue to unravel. The synthetic material is smooth and makes it difficult to double sock. This is also a sub par work sock for jobs that have you on your feet all day. Sweat will also need to be addressed cuz they fall short very short. All in all it dose compress well and they make my feet much warmer and happier so a fair sock for a fair price
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan S

customer_reviews.title: Tight and painful
customer_reviews.text: It fit very tight and I am 160lbs 5' 7" and for my husband it was tight and itchy. It also look like his feet was swollen and he never had swollen feet before. I just wanted him to wear it for his sweaty feet and so his feet doesn't feel tired....well his feet still sweat in these socks. Also when I took the sock off after my shift (6hrs), I had a sharp pain in my calf going down the stairs that I never had before. I bought the sock only to prevent varicose veins and long shifts since I will start a 12 hour shift next week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These would be great if the toe part wasn't so big it ballooned out
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these socks. They were cute, the price was great, and they offer fantastic compression. The toe part of them is "blousy" though, and way bigger than the diameter of the sock. When you put them on, there's a lot of extra fabric in the to area that bunches inside your shoes, and that gets quite uncomfortable on a long 12 hour shift. It's almost as if they toe part was made for a much larger sock. I have smallish (size 6) feet, so this may work better for people with bigger feet or fatter toes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The socks are okay, but small for a wide thick foot and large calf.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the sock is good, and the near knee high length is appropriate. I have a wide, thick foot, though not especially long, and quite large calves. So these socks were very difficult to get on, and since I have a large calf they were a bit too compressive.. I expect to get one wear per pair, but it is possible that wearing and washing will loosen them up a bit. If they shrink I will donate them.
customer_reviews.author: William Hall

customer_reviews.title: Quality compression socks at an affordable price backed by outstanding customer support.
customer_reviews.text: These compression socks are a perfect fit. They are 15-20 hg and fit comfortably just below my knee. I have short, thin legs but needed the larger size. 7 pairs of quality socks in 6 different colors for this price is unheard of these days. They were delivered in 2 days with Prime. Each pair of socks were individually wrapped. I had a small issue and contacted the seller. It was courteously and quickly resolved far beyond my expectations. If I ever needed more compression socks I would not hesitate to order from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: H. Mandel

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!  Open each individual sock package!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these socks; however, I could only give a three-star rating because of a quality control issue. f you purchase these, remove each individual pair of socks from their plastic package and inspect them carefully. I did not do that. I opened each pair as I used them and discovered that one of the pairs had a huge hole in the toe piece. It's too late to return them now, so buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: SMB

customer_reviews.title: Great socks, but go with the S/M if you’re on the bottom end of L/XL size
customer_reviews.text: Really like these socks, but sizing is slightly large. I usually wear a size 9 women’s shoe, and seeing they were compression socks I ordered the L/XL like the size chart said. The bad thing was I took them on vacation before I tried them on. The good thing they exchanged them for me even though three pies had been worn (I did wash them before returning them. The S/M fit perfect and I really feel like my feet and calves have more support. They don’t appear to have shrunk in the wash either. Planning on buying more.
customer_reviews.author: JenInATX

customer_reviews.title: very nice working out socks!
customer_reviews.text: So I originally got these for my mom with Restless leg syndrome but they were way too small for her so I decided to try them on when I went to work out and wow! These are a game changer! They allow me to feel secure and increase blood flow! They have a nice arch support and are really nice for the cramping I get when I am on the bike! Yes they feel tight but they are compression socks! They are doing their job! and they come in every color to literally match any workout outfit I have!
customer_reviews.author: JessieJessJess

customer_reviews.title: Not for big calves
customer_reviews.text: Certain reviews led me to believe that these would be okay even though my calves are 1-2 inches larger that the recommended size. I can get them on, I can wear for about 4-6 hours until they are too tight at the knee. But, otherwise, they are fantastic. I will continue to wear them and they will get easier as I lose weight. They do not take car of all the swelling, but I have an underlying cause that will keep them from doing that.
customer_reviews.author: KristinaB

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by my doctor.
customer_reviews.text: My wound care doctor recommended these for me based on price and the fact that they come in a multitude of cool colors - if I have to wear the darned things, I might as well have some fun with them! The fit is good - Complaints about the looseness of the toe section being too big are true, but not a real factor for me despite the fact I have very narrow feet. They are a little looser than the same strength hose I'd purchased at a medical supply house, but my doctor didn't see this as an issue for me. I'll buy more (in fancier patterns).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy on but poor fabric quality
customer_reviews.text: The large is easier to get on and provides comfort and compression for my mild lymphedema. However the quality of the material is not great. The photos are from one week's use, washed gently and HUNG DRY. So, there was no reason my finger should have punched through the fabric that easily, and the snags just appeared. Lots of socks for the money but if you are looking for top quality, this batch does not meet that standard. Again, I have mild swelling so for the price I'll just cycle through them.
customer_reviews.author: Spartacus

customer_reviews.title: Saved my ankles from swelling in Europe.
customer_reviews.text: PRO-TIP: Order up a size otherwise compression socks IN GENERAL are too tight and difficult to put on. I ordered this 6-pack for my trip to Italy, where we had a lot of walking expected. I am a size 14, curvy figured woman. I have bad veins in my legs and if I literally don’t put my feet up every 4-6 hours, I just get swollen ankles. These socks, paired with leather flat loafers from Ecco, got me through Europe without any foot discomfort. I was able to walk for miles without any trouble, and they look stylish with the black leather loafers. This is a GREAT INVESTMENT.
customer_reviews.author: Star C.

customer_reviews.title: Great value, good compression...
customer_reviews.text: For the price you cannot beat them. Very comfortable even wearing in the hottest days of summer not to hot. I do work indoors but they do not wear hot. Seam to have just the right compression. I am a women and wear a size 9 shoe and I got the XL. I work 12 - 14 hrs on a concrete floor and I am on my feet most the night. These seem to be really helping my legs. Before they were swelling and my ankles where becoming blood shot. Has dramatically helped me. Now if i can just find something they will help my sore feet. :)
customer_reviews.author: B. Flesher

customer_reviews.title: Medium compression (less than athletic compression socks) good for all day wear
customer_reviews.text: These socks were not what I had expected, but they do the trick for encouraging circulation on long flights. They do not compress as strongly as my running compression socks, which actually makes them better for wearing all day. They are a bit loose in the toe box - I normally wear a women's US size 7 so I purchased the small socks. They fit well everywhere but the toe box, and even there they fit well enough to be completely comfortable in shoes. I would recommend these socks for anyone looking for medium compression that is comfortable to wear all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine B

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these compression socks after a week of swollen feet. I worried they would not fit well as I have calves only a cow could love. How nice it was that they fit well and pulled all the way up to my knees....... and stayed there. Wearing knee socks in the summer heat under my uniform worried me but I stayed cool and comfortable all day long. I wish I could describe the feeling I get with these socks on but I can't. It just feels wonderful. I would recommend them to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They seem to help a bit with my swelling and are pretty comfortable. I just wish they had more cushion on the bottom.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my rheumatoid arthritis causes bad swelling in my ankles, feet and shins. These seem to help a bit I guess, but when I take them off at night, I have swelling above the sock line. Not sure if that's a good thing either. I also wish they had a thicker / more reinforced bottom (they feel very thin in my shoes). A bit more cushion would be nice. This would cost them more of course, but I'd be willing to pay a couple extra dollars for a higher quality longer lasting product. Overall though, a good product and a decent price. I'm going to keep wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Design Dude

product_meta.title: Compression Socks for Men and Women - Best for Running, Athletic Sports, Flight,Travel,Crossfit
feature_bullets: 8 pairs in Every Package-We provide 8 Packs and you won't find any compression socks in this price with the best quality,most perfect fit,max reducing swelling and most suitable,compression.Perfect for a whole week without daily wash.We combine compression,fashion and ergonomics,backed by science,Doctor Approved,Designed for everyday energy which can help active people stay healthy and comfortable all day long, Revives&energizes tired achy feet!so you can conquer everything on that to-do list.

Key benefits-Our Compression Socks work by creating a‘pressure gradient’(using graduated compression of 15-20 mmHg) which helps to push oxygen-poor blood out of the feet and legs,and back to the heart.More blood pumping means more Healthier legs and less pain + swelling.Remove stress and stimulate every cell,reduce fatigue,soreness,cramping and prevent Varicose veins at the same time Ensure the healthy functioning of your circulatory system.Keep your legs feel “fresher” and more energized.

High Quality-We do our best to choose high quality ultra nylon and elastic fibers of our compression socks to provide most premium comfort and support. The seamless toe and the cushion all of the sole will not have no more blisters. Great quality, light weight and soft touch are our confidence to provide you perfect compression socks. combining function and comfort. In short, the perfect everyday compression sock for everything you do.

Give Your Best Support-Professional compression stockings are suitable for everyone. Progressive and therapeutic pressure design; strong compression at the ankle and gradually decreasing compression near the calf. Best support for runners, athletes, teacher,flight crew,receptionist, office worker,pregnant, young and old, in a variety of phases of life.Especially those looking for ways to help control swelling in the legs and feet.

100% "PERFECT FIT" GUARANTEE - We're on a mission to help everyone feel their best, because feeling energized, comfortable, and pain-free sets us up to rise to our potential. We're here to restlessly support you — to do more and go further in style and comfort. Passion and customer obsession is our key principle. if you are not happy with it,please contact us and we will refund you.
